decks.notes: The focus of this deck is to quickly establish early board presence using low-cost creatures like Spectral Sailor and Brineborn Cutthroat, while utilizing counterspells like Sinister Sabotage and Quench to protect them. The deck also aims to generate card advantage with cards like Nightpack Ambusher and Brazen Borrower. The mana base is optimized to ensure consistent access to both blue and green mana sources. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent early in the game and disrupt their game plan with counterspells and tempo plays.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a streamlined Mono Black Aggro strategy. The deck includes efficient creatures like Rankle, Master of Pranks, Knight of the Ebon Legion, and Priest of Forgotten Gods to pressure the opponent's life total. Additionally, it leverages disruptive creatures like Yarok's Fenlurker and Burglar Rat to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of removal spells like Murderous Rider and card draw engines like Midnight Reaper ensures that the deck can maintain a relentless pace and close out the game quickly.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly put pressure on the opponent with evasive creatures like Spectral Sailor, Nightpack Ambusher, and Brineborn Cutthroat. Utilizing counterspells such as Sinister Sabotage, Quench, and Negate to protect our threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Ramp and fixing with Fabled Passage and Once Upon a Time, as well as card selection with Opt and Castle Vantress, help maintain our aggression. The Simic color combination allows for a well-rounded aggro strategy with a mix of tempo and control elements to overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures like Robber of the Rich, Pelt Collector, and Gruul Spellbreaker to quickly pressure the opponent. Once Upon a Time helps find key creatures early in the game, while Castle Embereth provides additional damage. Domri, Anarch of Bolas and Domri's Ambush provide removal options to clear the way for attacks. Skarrgan Hellkite serves as a finisher, while Zhur-Taa Goblin helps ramp up mana. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient creature-based strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing removal spells, counterspells, and disruption to prevent the opponent from executing their game plan. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by generating card advantage with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Drawn from Dreams, while also having a win condition in cards like Liliana, Dreadhorde General and Realm-Cloaked Giant. The mana base of the deck allows for flexibility in casting spells of different colors while also providing utility lands like Castle Ardenvale and Temple of Silence.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana and playing powerful green creatures to overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing the mana ramp and powerful creatures like Questing Beast and Nissa, Who Shakes the World, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game and maintain that advantage throughout. The inclusion of cards like Vivien, Arkbow Ranger and The Great Henge provides additional advantages and options for the player. With a strong focus on aggression and efficient creature plays, this deck aims to win games quickly and decisively.

The main idea of this deck is to use a mix of counter spells, card draw, and tempo plays to establish an aggressive board presence using powerful Simic creatures. By utilizing creatures like Frilled Mystic, Nightpack Ambusher, and Brineborn Cutthroat, the deck aims to pressure opponents quickly and efficiently. The inclusion of cards like Brazen Borrower and Spectral Sailor provide additional versatility and disruption. Overall, the strategy revolves around playing threats and protecting them, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on establishing board control through resource management and ramping up to play powerful threats like Nissa, Oko, Feasting Troll King, and Hydroid Krasis. By using cards like Trail of Crumbs and Once Upon a Time to find and play key pieces quickly, this Simic Control deck aims to outvalue opponents by generating card advantage and overwhelming them with large creatures. The mana base is optimized to support the deck's curve and color requirements, allowing for consistent plays and a strong late-game presence.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using a variety of removal spells and counterspells to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also utilizes cards like Dance of the Manse to bring back important enchantments or artifacts from the graveyard, while Teferi, Time Raveler and Doom Foretold help to slow down the opponent's plays. With a mix of card advantage, disruption, and control elements, this deck aims to outlast the opponent and establish dominance in the late game.

Utilizing a variety of removal spells and counters, the deck aims to control the game while disrupting the opponent's strategy. Teferi, Time Raveler helps to shut down instant-speed plays, while Dance of the Manse can bring back key artifacts later in the game. Planar Cleansing acts as a reset button, clearing the board of threats. Oath of Kaya provides additional removal and life gain, while Thought Erasure disrupts the opponent's hand. Doom Foretold forces sacrifices and card disadvantage for the opponent. The deck's mana base allows for consistent access to all colors needed for its control strategy.

The main focus of this Golgari Aggro deck is to quickly build up a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with creatures and powerful synergies. By combining cards like The Great Henge, Witch's Oven, and Cauldron Familiar, the deck aims to generate recurring value and gain incremental advantages. Utilizing efficient threats like Questing Beast and Wicked Wolf, along with the ramp provided by Gilded Goose and Giant Opportunity, the deck can apply pressure early and consistently throughout the game. The inclusion of cards like Once Upon a Time and Rotting Regisaur helps maintain card advantage and ensure a steady stream of threats.

The deck focuses on aggressive creature plays and utilizing powerful spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It combines Gruul creatures like Questing Beast and Skarrgan Hellkite with removal spells like Shock and Domri's Ambush to control the board and deal damage efficiently. Domri, Anarch of Bolas provides additional creature support and boosts the deck's aggression. Nissa, Who Shakes the World helps ramp up mana and generate additional threats. The deck's mana base is built to support a fast and powerful early game, aiming to win quickly through creature damage.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm your opponent with aggressive creatures and quick, efficient damage. By utilizing creatures like Gruul Spellbreaker, Legion Warboss, and Questing Beast, along with powerful spells like Once Upon a Time and Domri, Anarch of Bolas, you can apply pressure early and often. The inclusion of cards like Bonecrusher Giant and Embercleave provide additional reach and removal options, while cards like Castle Embereth and Skarrgan Hellkite give you late-game finishers. Overall, this deck aims to be fast, consistent, and relentless in its pursuit of victory.

This deck focuses on quickly playing and re-playing cheap spells and creatures to deal damage to the opponent as fast as possible. By utilizing cards like Finale of Promise and Arclight Phoenix, this deck can overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells and creatures from the graveyard. The Royal Scions provide card draw and a powerful pump effect, while cards like Shock and Lava Coil help control the board and protect your creatures. This deck aims to end the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana to drop powerful creatures onto the battlefield, overwhelming the opponent with early aggression. Cards like Once Upon a Time and Castle Garenbrig help accelerate mana production, while creatures like Questing Beast and Vivien, Arkbow Ranger deal damage efficiently. The deck also includes cards like The Great Henge and Nissa, Who Shakes the World to generate additional advantage. The goal is to apply constant pressure on the opponent, utilizing the mono green creatures' strength and abilities to secure a quick victory.

This deck is focused on quickly dealing damage to the opponent using aggressive red creatures and non-creature spells. It takes advantage of cards like Torbran, Thane of Red Fell and Cavalcade of Calamity to increase the damage output from attacking creatures. The deck also includes cards like Light Up the Stage and Runaway Steam-Kin to maintain card advantage and ramp up mana quickly. By applying pressure with low-cost aggressive creatures and direct damage spells, the deck aims to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total and win the game before the opponent can stabilize.
